Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 6 for SLE 12 SP3)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 6 for SLE 12 SP3)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 4.4.103-6_33 fixes one issue.

The following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2017-17712: The raw_sendmsg() function had a race condition that lead to uninitialized stack pointer usage. This allowed a local user to execute code and gain privileges (bsc#1073230).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution for Non-Commercial usage (CC-BY-NC-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Live Patching 12 SP3
SUSE Linux Enterprise Live Patching 12 SP3

Vulnerabilities.Description: The raw_sendmsg() function in net/ipv4/raw.c in the Linux kernel through 4.14.6 has a race condition in inet->hdrincl that leads to uninitialized stack pointer usage; this allows a local user to execute code and gain privileges.
